content.description: Begin as for Conrad Vs The Skink Monster. Once on the ledge, drift left as the holds lead you, then angle back right when you are immediately below a long, few inch wide roof. Reach over to the longish right-facing corner and work extremely tiny footholds which verge on imaginary until you can reach the slightly flaring hand crackabove (crux). Once you've got the crack, you'll still have feet issues, but should be able to work it out to gain the top in a few short moves.
content.protection: long runners for top rope setup

content.description: A bit sustained, and requires some brains. Climb the jagged arete that leans funny up to where it meets the roof of Rags To Riches. Finish on the last moves of Rags To Riches. (Indy)
content.protection: Fixed top anchors accessible to leaders on Rags to Riches
content.location: Arete left of Rags To Riches

content.description: Staying out of the corner of Carpet Crack, climb straight up the face on small but decent finger ledges to the top. The arete is off route as well. (Indy)
Begin 10' left of Air Show, climb corner crack system up to the roof.Â
content.protection: Trad protection (see description). Fixed Top anchors, hidden from view from above, visible to the leader when they are topping out.
content.location: This is the dihedral/corner near the center of the cliff.

content.description: Instead of heading up left, climb directly up to a fissure notch at the top of the wall. Climb up that until you run out of rock. (Indy)
Named for the amount of lichen that showered down on the climber when he was looking up. Start at a broken finger crack 8' left of White Man Head Bob.
content.protection: Fixed Anchors for leading and fixed top anchors
content.location: Near the left end of the cliff

content.description: Finnish for "moonlight". Begin either on Eyes Of A Stranger or at a blocky corner 5' further left of that. Climb up 8' to a stance and high-step into the widely flared crack and gently following it for a few moves until it peters out. If you are height-challenged, you will need to make a couple of creative and delicate moves (crux), possibly employing a mono-doigt pocket in the face, in order to gain a hand ledge up right (but thin feet). Reach up, crank down, and hit the top. (Indy)
content.protection: long runners for top rope setup
content.location: Far left end of the cliff

content.description: Start on the broken hand crack 8' left of Oh My Eyes!. Once standing on the ledge, make a very commiting move (crux) to head straight up and right to grab a deep ledge. Without losing momentum, keep angling up and right to gain the right-facing flakes of Oh My Eyes!. Finish on Oh My Eyes!. You might consider this a variant start for ...Eyes! or a worthy standalone route. (Indy)
content.protection: Fixed top anchors or long runners from natural features

content.description: Really, though, there is only one tree to dance with. Begin at the series of short, blocky right-facing corners 8' left of Driving With The Top Down. Climb up these short corners to a stance. Then either step right and continue up the main corner (awkward, with the tree) until it ends, or aim slightly left and ascend the outside face just left of the main corner on a series of welcome but not obvious holds (avoids dancing with the tree). Where the two lines meet again, follow the thin crack in the face left of the shallow left-leaning corner to the top. There are other finish variations to this route on the right. (Indy)
content.protection: long runners for top rope setup

content.description: Start on the small boulder at the base of the cliff 5' left of Unyielding Finale arete. Follow the line of weakness up, trending somewhat right, to a small overhang. Continue up gently right (crux) and then straight up to some horizontals near the top. The nice holds around the crux lean the wrong way. Enjoy! (Indy)
content.protection: Long runners for Top rope anchors

content.description: Begin at the crack system 6' left of Dancing With Trees, just right of a medium-sized oak tree growing next to the base of the cliff. Climb up to a ledge, then delicately work straight up the face to the small roof near the top of the wall. The crux here is finding feet while on tiny crimps for the hands. Pull past the roof by following the crack and corner on the right. (Indy)
content.protection: long runners for top rope setup

content.description: This dihedral has a crack to either jam or layback.
content.location: Far right side of the cliff.

content.description: Constrain yourself to the arete immediately left of Skink Magic to the roof. Finish by continuing up the face, using the arching left arete as needed. For more fun, pull the roof when you get to it, finishing on easier moves. (Indy)

This is a fun alternate finish to âRags to Richesâ.  Climb Rags to Riches to the large roof near the top of the climb.  Lean out right to follow the center crack line, likely with a bat swing move.  Pulling the roof is easier done feet first if you have the flexibility other wise you may need to bump up the ratting.
content.protection: Tape for the hands!! Tree anchors at top.
content.location: Located at the large right facing corner.

content.description: Same as Air Show but head right through the roof rather than taking the crack out left.

Begin in the middle of the broad, lichen-free face below the wide roof 10' left of Bluepill. Climb up the face on small holds that just get more and more technical. At the roof (V1), climb up through the weakness that forms a small right-facing corner to the top.Â
content.protection: Long runners for top anchors. Be careful of sharp edges, use a rope protector (recommended).
content.location: Slabby face to roof right of Rags to Riches corner

content.description: Portions of the cliff grow a fine powdery lichen. Angles vary. Long approach
